patch

Summary
The list of all database patches. These are used to coordinate database migrations. During database migration checks, the list of patches on the file system are compared to the list of patches known in this table. f


Fields Type Attributes Description
displayString  abstractText
max length: 1000
allows all 		abstract
  		A human readable semi-unique value used to identify each model. This typically uses something like the model's name or code which is expected to be unique enough to distinish between the different values within a particular project.  
installedLocalDate  date abstract
  		The installed date based on the user's local timezone.  
installedLocalTime  time abstract
  		The installed time of day based on the user's local timezone.  
installedLocalTs  timestamp abstract
  		The installed timestamp converted to the user's local timezone.  
installedLocalTsMessage  text100
max length: 100
allows printable 		abstract
  		The installed timestamp converted to the user's local timezone, and formatted as a string that includes the timezone code.  
installedUtcTs  timestamp required
  		The date and time when the patch was installed in this database.  
name  name
max length: 50
allows printable 		primary key
  		The unique key. This is typically a short date-ish value such as: 20140131-1.txt. The patches are applied in the sequence implied by their collating sequence.  
source  bigText
max length: 50000
allows printable
allows whitespace 		required
  		The full raw script. This contains both the text originally used to upgrade, as well as the text used to subsequently downgrade. Each script has a maximum length of 50,000 characters.  


Collections Type Comment
